page.title: 15*OUT AND ABOUT IN HASWELL*
page.content: Haswell has quite a big church called St. Paul's.Services start at 9.30a.m and are taken by Rev. Bill Rumball. I think he is a children's vicar because he makes nearly everything like old shoes and garden spades resemble Christ. There is a Sunday school every week unless there is a Family Service. There is also a chapel in Haswell. It is not very big.It has been painted white and was built in 1849. It has few services as not many people go to chapel now.It has a total congregation of about 10 people. There is an old pit but it is in ruins now.Today the pit is very picturesque and the heaps are grassed over. The Community Centre is one of the newest buildings.There are discos and film shows.The doctor's surgery is also held there.
